title: CCC Intermediate Quiz
description: Advanced CCC concepts including LibreOffice advanced features, internet security, and digital literacy

questions.question: Which menu in LibreOffice Writer contains the Mail Merge option?
questions.explanation: Mail Merge option is available in the Tools menu of LibreOffice Writer.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Mail Merge in LibreOffice Writer?
questions.explanation: Mail Merge is used to send bulk personalized letters or documents to multiple recipients.

questions.question: Which function in LibreOffice Calc is used to find the sum of a range?
questions.explanation: SUM() function calculates the sum of values in a specified range in LibreOffice Calc.

questions.question: What is the shortcut key to insert a new slide in LibreOffice Impress?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + M is used to insert a new slide in LibreOffice Impress.

questions.question: Which protocol is used for receiving emails?
questions.explanation: POP3 (Post Office Protocol 3) is used for receiving emails from mail server.

questions.question: What is two-factor authentication?
options: Additional security layer using two verification methods
questions.explanation: Two-factor authentication adds extra security by requiring two different verification methods.

questions.question: Which of these is a strong password characteristic?
options: Mix of letters, numbers, and symbols
questions.explanation: Strong passwords contain a mix of uppercase, lowercase letters, numbers, and special symbols.

questions.question: What is phishing?
options: Fraudulent attempt to obtain sensitive information
questions.explanation: Phishing is a fraudulent attempt to obtain sensitive information by impersonating trustworthy entities.

questions.question: Which LibreOffice application is used for mathematical formulas?
questions.explanation: LibreOffice Math is specifically designed for creating and editing mathematical formulas.

questions.question: What is the purpose of styles in LibreOffice Writer?
questions.explanation: Styles ensure consistent formatting throughout the document and make editing easier.

questions.question: Which key combination applies bold formatting?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + B applies bold formatting to selected text in LibreOffice applications.

questions.question: What is a digital signature?
questions.explanation: Digital signature is an electronic signature that ensures document authenticity and integrity.

questions.question: Which chart type is best for showing parts of a whole in LibreOffice Calc?
questions.explanation: Pie chart is best for showing parts of a whole or percentage distribution.

questions.question: What is the purpose of conditional formatting in LibreOffice Calc?
questions.explanation: Conditional formatting automatically formats cells based on their values or specified conditions.

questions.question: Which protocol ensures secure data transmission over internet?
questions.explanation: HTTPS (HTTP Secure) ensures encrypted and secure data transmission over the internet.

questions.question: What is a macro in LibreOffice?
questions.explanation: Macro is an automated sequence of commands that can be recorded and played back.

questions.question: Which function key opens Help in LibreOffice applications?
questions.explanation: F1 key opens the Help system in LibreOffice applications.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Track Changes in LibreOffice Writer?
questions.explanation: Track Changes monitors and records all modifications made to the document.

questions.question: Which internet service allows real-time text communication?
questions.explanation: Chat or Instant Messaging allows real-time text communication between users.

questions.question: What is a template in LibreOffice?
questions.explanation: Template is a pre-designed document format that can be used to create new documents.

questions.question: Which feature in LibreOffice Writer helps in creating table of contents?
questions.explanation: Styles and Headings are used to automatically generate table of contents.

questions.question: What is the purpose of pivot tables in LibreOffice Calc?
questions.explanation: Pivot tables are used to summarize, analyze, and present large amounts of data.

questions.question: Which type of malware replicates itself?
questions.explanation: Virus is malware that replicates itself and spreads to other files or systems.

questions.question: What is the purpose of slide transitions in LibreOffice Impress?
questions.explanation: Slide transitions create animated effects when moving from one slide to another.

questions.question: Which feature allows multiple users to work on the same document simultaneously?
questions.explanation: Collaboration or sharing features allow multiple users to work on the same document simultaneously.

questions.question: What is the difference between Save and Save As?
options: Save updates existing file, Save As creates new file
questions.explanation: Save updates the existing file, while Save As creates a new file with a different name or location.

questions.question: Which feature in LibreOffice Calc allows data validation?
questions.explanation: Data Validity feature allows setting rules for data entry validation in cells.

questions.question: What is a cookie in web browsing?
options: Small data file stored by websites
questions.explanation: Cookie is a small data file stored by websites to remember user preferences and information.

questions.question: Which key combination applies italic formatting?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + I applies italic formatting to selected text in LibreOffice applications.

questions.question: What is the purpose of headers and footers in documents?
questions.explanation: Headers and footers display consistent information (like page numbers, titles) on every page.

questions.question: Which protocol is used for secure file transfer?
questions.explanation: SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol) provides secure file transfer with encryption.

questions.question: What is the purpose of page breaks in documents?
options: Force content to start on new page
questions.explanation: Page breaks force content to start on a new page, controlling document layout.

questions.question: Which feature allows automatic correction of common typing errors?
questions.explanation: AutoCorrect automatically fixes common typing errors and typos as you type.

questions.question: What is bandwidth in internet terms?
questions.explanation: Bandwidth refers to the data transfer capacity or maximum rate of data transfer.

questions.question: Which feature in LibreOffice allows finding and replacing text?
questions.explanation: Find & Replace feature allows searching for specific text and replacing it with new text.

questions.question: What is the purpose of slide master in LibreOffice Impress?
questions.explanation: Slide master controls the overall design and formatting of all slides in the presentation.

questions.question: Which type of chart shows trends over time?
questions.explanation: Line chart is best for showing trends and changes over time periods.

questions.question: What is social engineering in cybersecurity?
questions.explanation: Social engineering involves manipulating people to reveal confidential information or perform actions.

questions.question: Which feature allows protecting documents with passwords?
questions.explanation: Documents can be protected using encryption, password protection, and various security features.

questions.question: What is the purpose of bookmarks in web browsers?
options: Save favorite websites for quick access
questions.explanation: Bookmarks save favorite websites for quick and easy access later.

questions.question: Which feature allows automatic numbering of pages?
questions.explanation: Page numbers can be inserted through headers, footers, or dedicated page numbering features.

questions.question: What is the difference between copying and moving files?
options: Copy creates duplicate, move transfers location
questions.explanation: Copy creates a duplicate while keeping original, move transfers file to new location.

questions.question: Which protocol is used for web page transfer?
questions.explanation: HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol) and HTTPS are used for transferring web pages.

questions.question: What is the purpose of spell check in word processors?
questions.explanation: Spell check identifies and helps correct spelling errors in documents.

questions.question: Which feature allows creating forms in LibreOffice?
questions.explanation: Form Controls allow creating interactive forms with input fields, buttons, and other elements.

questions.question: What is the purpose of data sorting in spreadsheets?
questions.explanation: Data sorting arranges information in ascending or descending order based on specified criteria.

questions.question: Which key combination redoes the last undone action?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + Y redoes the last action that was undone with Ctrl + Z.

questions.question: What is the purpose of data filtering in spreadsheets?
options: Display specific data based on criteria
questions.explanation: Data filtering displays only the data that meets specific criteria, hiding the rest.

questions.question: Which feature allows inserting current date and time automatically?
questions.explanation: Insert Date/Time feature allows automatic insertion of current date and time in documents.

questions.question: What is the purpose of version control in document management?
questions.explanation: Version control tracks and manages changes to documents over time, maintaining history.
